sen.e: A year after Genji returned to Kyoto, Hitachi no kuni no suke (the Lord of Hitachi Province) (the former Iyo no kuni no suke (Assistant Governor of Iyo Province)) wound up his service and came back with his wife, Utsusemi.

sen.e: Remembering good old days, Genji called Utsusemi's younger brother, Uemon no suke (Assistant Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards) (former Kogimi) to his presence and sent her a letter.

sen.j: その後も二人は文を交わしたが、やがて常陸介が亡くなり、一人残された空蝉は継子の河内国守（元紀伊国守）の懸想を避けて出家した。
sen.e: They exchanged letters later, but before long Hitachi no suke passed away, and Utsusemi, who was left alone, became a nun to avoid her stepchild, Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province) (former Ki no kuni no kami (Governor of Ki Province)), who was in love with her.
